results.title: Black by popular demand: black and blue: black women in jazz and blues music.
results.brief_description: These two documentaries take a traditional approach to familiar subjects and rely for their impact on the strength of the stories they have to tell. ‘Tiny and Ruby: hell divin’ women’ (Producer Andrea Weiss, director Greta Schiller) evokes the masculine milieu of the American jazz scene that two marginalised women have managed to succeed in. ‘Wild women don’t have the blues’ (Producers Carol Doyle Van Vallenburgh) mixes the oral history of now veteran performers with archive footage, old photographs and sound recordings to revise male-oriented preconceptions around development of the blues. Both stories are set against an economic and social context in which black people were far from equal, emphasising the strength, determination and sheer power of women who live on their music. This compilation will appeal not only to those interested in blues and jazz, but is also a good example for cinema studies for it’s documentary, drama and animation style.
results.title_for_label: Black by popular demand: black and blue: black women in jazz and blues music.

results.title: Birds of the seashore
results.creator_credit: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A close-up view of the water birds of Canada’s east coast - their habits, breeding grounds, peculiarities and distinguishing marks. Included are herring gulls, gannets, eider ducks, great blue herons, black guillemots, razor-billed auks and cormorants. Throughout the film many bird calls are heard.

results.title: Birds of Canada. No. 6
results.creator_credit: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The pileated woodpecker, the yellow-bellied sapsucker and the common loon are objects of study in this film. The distinguishing features of the woodpecker and sapsucker are pointed out, while the loon, a water bird, comes in for special mention.

results.title: Birdman of paradise; William T. Cooper: portrait painter to the birds
results.creator_credit: Paul Reddish, Robert Campbell, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: John Young is an expert on Australia’s Birds of Paradise. These rare birds are difficult to track and we follow John’s endeavours to record the mating rituals and displays of these birds. Bird artist William Cooper’s illustrations are considered the finest in this genre of painting. Sir David Attenborough narrates this program on a truly great artist.

results.title: Black and white [DVD]
results.creator_credit: James Toback, Ron Rotholz, Palm Pictures and Screen Gems
results.brief_description: James Toback (Two girls and a guy, The Pick up artist) directed and wrote “Black and white” the setting for which is the New York hip-hop/rap scene. Following numerous stories “Black and white” is part rumination on the cultural re-appropriation of black hip-hop/rap music by affluent white American teenagers. Charlie, Wren, Scotty and Jesse are rich Upper West-side teens, hanging with a black gang (some of whom have become friends/lovers) picking up on the language and imitating the aesthetic of rap culture; Terry and Sam are documentary filmmakers (unharmoniously married) filming these white teens; Mark is a gambler seeking a fix on a game from basketball player Dean; Cigar and crew are rappers trying to cut a record; Rich Bower is the power broker among the black rappers whose business dealings draw those around him into dangerous ventures. This film is an examination of the intersection of white and black culture in New York, which uses overlapping storylines to present a multitude of narratives. Starring: Robert Downey Jr, Brooke Shields, Elijah Woods, Claudia Schiffer, Ben Stiller, Jared Leto, Joe Pantoliano, Mike Tyson and Bijou Phillips.

results.title: Bizarre cults
results.creator_credit: Ashley Sidaway, Ellis Elias, John Thompson and 21st Century Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Narrated by Sir David Frost, this program gives a brief overview of some of the major cults from around the world and includes information about what they believe and how they were founded. Cults covered include: Charles Manson’s family; Branch Davidians; Aum Shrinriko, Moonies; the Order of the Solar Temple; Children of God; Hare Krishnas; Druidism; Flagellants; the Spacepeople of Damanhur; the Church of Scientology; Evangelism; Jehovah’s Witness; Voodooism. Personalities covered include: Charles Manson; David Koresh; Shoko Asohara; L. Ron Hubbard; Tammy and Jim Baker.

results.title: Bits and bytes. Parts 1-12
results.creator_credit: David Stansfield, Denise Boiteau, Stuart Beecroft, Time-Life Video and TV Ontario
results.brief_description: Part 1. ‘Getting started’. Part 2. “Ready made programs’. Part 3. ‘How programs work’. Part 4. ‘Storing information’. Part 5. ‘Communication between computers’. Part 6.’Computer languages’. Part 7. ‘Computer assisted instruction’. Part 8. ‘Learning objectives’. Part 9. ‘Computer Graphics’. Part 10 ‘Computer music’. Part 11. ‘Computers at work’. Part 12 ‘What next’. Based on the Apple II series computer, and IBM, there are sound basic explanations about basic computer functions and programs.

results.title: Birth of the Bomb (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This is the background story of the making of the first atomic bomb. The period covered is from 1938 to the dropping of the bomb on Hiroshima in 1945. German efforts to create an atomic bomb are described. the intensive research into the development of the bomb in the US is dealt with extensively. Includes archival film and interviews with some of those involved.

results.title: Birdlovers of New South Wales: the story of the Gould League
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of the foundation and growth of the Gould League of Birdlovers, who study, watch and protect native birds. Photography by Harry Malcolm with majority of bird shots by Norman Chaffer. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Bill Henson: dreams of darkness
results.creator_credit: Philippe Marie Charluet and Special Broadcasting Service Corporation
results.brief_description: This program centres around the work of Bill Henson and the exhibition of his work at the Venice Biennale in 1996. Through interviews with Henson himself, colleagues, critics and gallery convenors, his unique, dream-like style of work and exhibition practices are presented and discussed in critical detail. The program touches on many issues related to his work and its presentation including interpretations surrounding the borderline soft pornographic elements to his pieces. Diverse opinions about such issues are drawn from the attendants of the Venice Biennale as well as from the range of interviewees already mentioned, including Henson. It is a visually dense and thorough analytical program offering an interesting insight into the work of this critically acclaimed Australian artist.
